newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian court to mull proceedings vs Norilsk plant.
newsitem.headline: Russian court to mull proceedings vs Norilsk plant.

text.p: A Russian court may consider starting bankruptcy proceedings against the flagship plant of metals group Norilsk Nickel, a court official said on Tuesday.

"On July 18, we will look at this case...but we would probably need time to investigate the problem," said the official at the Krasnoyarsk regional arbitration court, which has jurisdiction over the matter. She said the court was considering complaints from Norilsk's energy supplier, Norilskgazprom, which says Norilsk owes it billions of roubles for gas supplies and which has already cut deliveries.
Russian courts have often said they may liquidate insolvent enterprises but there are almost no instances of this actually happening.

Norilsk, the lead plant of the RAO Norilsky Nikel group, one of the world's top producers of nickel, cobalt and platinum group metals, said last month a one-third reduction in gas supplies was hitting metals production.

Norilskgazprom says the financially-troubled flagship plant, based in the Arctic town of Norilsk, owes it 1.9 trillion roubles ($330 million). The plant also has major tax arrears totalling about as much as the gas debts, but it is improving the timeliness of tax payments. ($1 = 5,779 roubles)
